title: P above MC in monopolistic competition

content.question: Which of the following is true of a monopolistically competitive firm in long-run equilibrium?

choices.label: The firm produces the allocatively efficient level of output.
The firm is allocatively inefficient, because it produces an output level at which price is greater than marginal cost.
The firm produces an output level that minimizes average total cost.
The firm produces in the inelastic range of its demand curve.
The firm earns positive economic profits but zero accounting profits.

content.answer: The firm is allocatively inefficient, because it produces an output level at which price is greater than marginal cost.
